question: Can I afford a mortgage with a monthly payment of $1,500, an interest rate of 3.5%, and a 30-year term, considering my annual income is $80,000?
true_answer: Yes, with your income, a $1,500 monthly payment is affordable under the specified conditions.

steps.content: Can I afford a mortgage with a monthly payment of $1,500, an interest rate of 3.5%, and a 30-year term, considering my annual income is $80,000?
Plan: 1) Calculate affordability with home_loan_agent. 2) Confirm with credit_agent based on financial obligations. 3) Review via supervisor_agent. 4) Provide answer.
Calculating affordability based on $1,500 monthly payment and $80,000 annual income.
The monthly payment of $1,500 is 22.5% of your monthly income. Typically, should be below 28%.
Checking for any significant financial obligations that could affect affordability.
No significant obligations found. Financial health seems good.
What if I have an existing car loan?
Retrieving knowledge on impact of existing loans on mortgage affordability.
Typically, all debts combined should not exceed 36% of your income.
Recalculating affordability with an assumed $300 monthly car loan.
With car loan, total debt-to-income is 27.5%, still below 36%.
Review complete. All criteria met for affordability.
Yes, with your income, a $1,500 monthly payment is affordable under the specified conditions, even considering a car loan.
